verbs.description: supersaturate (third-person singular simple present supersaturates, present participle supersaturating, simple past and past participle supersaturated)

entries.meaning: To cause a solution to have more solute dissolved in it than it can stably contain at current conditions.
examples: In science class the teacher prepared a supersaturated solution by cooling a saturated solution. He then added a small seed crystal and a large precipitate formed in just a second.
